content_text: Resources are things that satisfy our needs.
Anything that can be used to satisfy a need.
Resources that are non-living (e.g., soils, rocks, minerals).
Resources which get renewed or replenished quickly.
Development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.
Students think resources are simply free gifts available for unlimited use.
explanation: Natural resources are not free gifts; they are a function of human activities.
common_misconception: Resources require time, technology, and effort to transform into useful substances.

content_text: Students think all renewable resources are unlimited.
explanation: Water seems unlimited but shortage is a major problem.
common_misconception: Careless use of certain renewable resources like water, soil and forest can affect their stock.
